Name: Headless standing statue of Shepses-Ptah
Description: This standing statue comes from the mastaba of Shepses-Ptah in Giza. The head, neck and part of the shoulders, left arm and lower leg are missing. Part of the left lower leg has been restored.The arms are pendant, the hands fisted. The white apron-fronted kilt is just above knee length. Shepses-Ptah is leaning against a narrow back pillar. His name and title are carved on the top of the base.
